intro: Kadua lucei, commonly known as the Hawaiian ironwood, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, woody growth and dark green leaves. The plant produces small, white to yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Kadua lucei is known for its hardiness and ability to thrive in coastal and dry forest habitats. It plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soils and providing habitat for native wildlife.
